extracted_playbook.title: Implement Sandboxed Browsers
extracted_playbook.description: Consider implementing sandboxed browsers to protect systems from malware originating from web browsing. Sandboxed browsers isolate the host machine from malicious code.

extracted_playbook.title: Enforce Password Policies
extracted_playbook.description: Require all accounts with password logins to comply with NIST standards for developing and managing password policies. Enforce use of longer passwords consisting of at least 15 characters.

extracted_playbook.title: Store Passwords Securely
extracted_playbook.description: Store passwords in a salted and hashed format using industry-recognized password hashing algorithms. Prevent use of commonly used or known-compromised passwords.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Account Lockouts
extracted_playbook.description: Implement multiple failed login attempt account lockouts and disable password hints.

extracted_playbook.title: Require Admin Credentials for Software Installation
extracted_playbook.description: Require administrator credentials to install software.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Email and Firewall Filters
extracted_playbook.description: Implement filters at the email gateway to filter out emails with known malicious indicators and block suspicious IP addresses at the firewall.

extracted_playbook.title: Install Web Application Firewall
extracted_playbook.description: Install a web application firewall and configure with appropriate rules to protect enterprise assets.

extracted_playbook.title: Segment Networks
extracted_playbook.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware by controlling traffic flows and restricting adversary lateral movement.

extracted_playbook.title: Follow Least-Privilege Best Practice
extracted_playbook.description: Require administrators to use administrative accounts for managing systems and use simple user accounts for non-administrative tasks. Enforce the management of and audit user accounts with administrative privileges.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Time-Based Access for Admin Accounts
extracted_playbook.description: Implement time-based access for accounts set at the admin level and higher, such as the Just-in-Time (JIT) access method.

extracted_playbook.title: Keep Systems Updated
extracted_playbook.description: Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date. Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities in internet-facing systems.

extracted_playbook.title: Restrict Service Account Access
extracted_playbook.description: Restrict service accounts from remotely accessing other systems. Configure group policy to deny log on locally and through Terminal Services for all service accounts.

extracted_playbook.title: Block Direct Internet Access for Admin Interfaces
extracted_playbook.description: Block direct internet access for administration interfaces and for remote access.

extracted_playbook.title: Require Phishing-Resistant MFA
extracted_playbook.description: Require phishing-resistant multifactor authentication for all services, particularly for webmail, VPNs, and privileged accounts.

extracted_playbook.title: Consolidate and Monitor Internet Gateways
extracted_playbook.description: Consolidate, monitor, and defend internet gateways.

extracted_playbook.title: Enable Real-Time Antivirus Detection
extracted_playbook.description: Install, regularly update, and enable real-time detection for antivirus software on all hosts.

extracted_playbook.title: Raise Phishing Awareness
extracted_playbook.description: Raise awareness for phishing threats in your organization and provide practical training on the risks associated with email use.

extracted_playbook.title: Add External Email Warning Banner
extracted_playbook.description: Consider adding an external email warning banner for emails sent to or received from outside of your organization.

extracted_playbook.title: Review Internet-Facing Services
extracted_playbook.description: Review internet-facing services and disable any services that are no longer a business requirement to be exposed or restrict access to only those users with an explicit requirement.

extracted_playbook.title: Review Domain Controllers and Active Directories
extracted_playbook.description: Review domain controllers, servers, workstations, and active directories for new and/or unrecognized accounts. Regularly verify the security level of the Active Directory domain by checking for misconfigurations.

extracted_playbook.title: Develop and Update Network Diagrams
extracted_playbook.description: Develop and regularly update comprehensive network diagrams that describe systems and data flows within your organization’s networks.

extracted_playbook.title: Control and Restrict Network Connections
extracted_playbook.description: Control and restrict network connections accordingly with a network flow matrix.

extracted_playbook.title: Enable Enhanced PowerShell Logging
extracted_playbook.description: Enable enhanced PowerShell logging, including module, script block, and transcription logging. Ensure PowerShell instances are configured to use the latest version.

extracted_playbook.title: Configure Windows Registry for UAC Approval
extracted_playbook.description: Configure the Windows Registry to require UAC approval for any PsExec operations requiring administrator privileges.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Command-Line and Scripting Activities
extracted_playbook.description: Disable command-line and scripting activities and permissions to prevent privilege escalation and lateral movement.

extracted_playbook.title: Enable Credential Guard
extracted_playbook.description: Enable Credential Guard to protect Windows system credentials. Be aware of the limitations when enabling this security control.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Local Administrator Password Solution (LAPS)
extracted_playbook.description: Implement Local Administrator Password Solution (LAPS) where possible if your OS is older than Windows Server 2019 and Windows 10.

extracted_playbook.title: Apply Local Security Policies for Application Execution
extracted_playbook.description: Apply local security policies to control application execution with a strict allowlist.

extracted_playbook.title: Establish Application Allowlist
extracted_playbook.description: Establish an application allowlist of approved software applications and binaries that are allowed to be executed on a system.

extracted_playbook.title: Restrict NTLM Uses
extracted_playbook.description: Restrict NTLM uses with security policies and firewalling.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Unused Ports
extracted_playbook.description: Disable ports that are not being used for business purposes, such as RDP-TCP Port 3389.

extracted_playbook.title: Identify and Eliminate Critical Active Directory Control Paths
extracted_playbook.description: Identify Active Directory control paths and eliminate the most critical among them according to the business needs and assets.

extracted_playbook.title: Detect and Investigate Abnormal Activity
extracted_playbook.description: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity and potential traversal of ransomware with a networking monitoring tool.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Tiering Model for Trust Zones
extracted_playbook.description: Implement a tiering model by creating trust zones dedicated to an organization’s most sensitive assets.

extracted_playbook.title: Block Connections to Known Malicious Systems
extracted_playbook.description: Block connections to known malicious systems by using a Transport Layer Security (TLS) Proxy.

extracted_playbook.title: Use Web Filtering or CASB
extracted_playbook.description: Use web filtering or a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) to restrict or monitor access to public-file sharing services.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement a Recovery Plan
extracted_playbook.description: Implement a recovery plan to maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location.

extracted_playbook.title: Maintain Offline Backups
extracted_playbook.description: Maintain offline backups of data, and regularly maintain backup and restoration. Follow the 3-2-1 backup strategy.

extracted_playbook.title: Ensure Backup Data is Encrypted and Immutable
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure all backup data is encrypted, immutable, and covers the entire organization’s data infrastructure.
